Text: ...Okay! Next!

...Alright! Let's take a 30-minute break!
Don't forget to stay hydrated!

If the Shadow Garden grows any larger, securing
enough training space will be a real challenge!
Village...is cramped...
That's right! Cramped!

I'm happy our pack is growing! Not happy it's getting
cramped!

True, I'm not happy about it either. It's starting to
interfere with Lambda's training of our members.
Hey, Epsilon! Don't copy what I said!
Huhhh...?!

Based on my calculations, this ghost town will become
a fully thriving village in a month...if our numbers
continue to increase at the current rate.

Available living spaces are also running out. We're
fast approaching a situation where we can't keep
our presence here a secret any longer.
Lady Alpha!

It looks like we can't wait for Zeta any longer.
She'll return today, so we'll narrow down the
list of potential new locations for our base
when she gets here.

Well then, let's adjourn the meeting until Zeta
returns.
...Fine...I'll sleep...
Always asleep like a log, aren't you?

But Delta, you usually sleep through meetings
too...
If you're so jealous, why don't you copy me?

I hate people copying what I say, but I don't mind if
you copy what I do! I'd be honored!
Um, well... I think I'll pass on both!
...I'm home.
Oh, the cat returns.
Were you in the middle of a meeting?
Welcome back, Zeta. We were just taking a break.

The plan was to reconvene as soon as you returned.
It's up to youâ€”would you like to rest up first?

No, we can get started immediately. With all the time
I had, I managed to find a promising location.
Good house...where?!
Well then, shall we resume the meeting, Lady Alpha?
Very well. So Zeta, where is this promising place?
...The ancient city of Alexandria.
Alexandria? I've never heard of such a place.
Neither have I. Have you, Beta?
Um...yes, to some extent.

It's described in ancient legends as a city that
exists far to the east of the Sacred Land of
Lindwurm, beyond the Abyss Woods.

However, it only appears in legends and folkloreâ€”its
existence is yet to be confirmed.

This is because the Abyss Woods itself is said to be
filled with a deadly mist, and those who enter never
return.

But that makes it the perfect place where no one will
disturb us. Even if there is no ancient city, I think it's
the best candidate for our base.

Of course, it's important we find a place where we
won't be disturbed, but...
Lady Alpha?

"Beyond that heavy mist lies the land of shadows
where we must rise"â€”that's what he told me.

Wait, did Master Shadow...reveal to us that the
ancient city of Alexandria is a suitable location
for our base?!
So...Alexandria really does exist!
Then the choice has been made for us.

We'll need to prepare to travel through the
Abyss Woods and investigate the ancient
city of Alexandria beyond.

Agreed. In the following days, let's gather our
battle-ready members and prepare for travel.
Ooh! I know! That's what they call a "picnic"!
I'll...pass...

Delta mentioned something about everyone going on a
picnic when she dropped by the other day.
A picnic? Oh, she means investigating our new base.

If the Garden is always by your side as we begin to
launch full-scale operations, we may inadvertently
reveal your existence to the worldâ€”and to the
Cult of Diablos.

We plan to prevent this by moving the Shadow Garden's
base to a secluded location...deep within the Abyss
Woods.

So that's the excuse you're going with just to
exclude me...
Cid? Is something wrong?
Nope, nothing.

Our one concern is the folklore surrounding the
Abyss Woods. It speaks of a transcendent being
known as the Mist Dragon.
I doubt we'll encounter an actual dragon...

But it may be a metaphor for some powerful monster,
so we intend to proceed with caution.
A dragon, huh...

(Sounds like things might get interesting. Think I'll
check what Alpha and the others get up to without
crashing their girls' picnic.)

(Not that I don't understand why they wouldn't want
to bring a boy into the mix at a girls-only picnic...)
